revised_title: The Ancient Carteia and Roman Towns: A Discourse on Their Location and Significance
tldr: The author, John Conduitt, explores the location and significance of the ancient city of Carteia and other Roman towns in the region. He examines the ruins, inscriptions, and artifacts found at the site, and discusses the historical and geographical context of the area. Conduitt also compares and contrasts different interpretations of ancient texts, such as those by Livy and Mela, to better understand the location of Carteia and its significance in Roman history.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
